title: Trump says administration will offer buyouts to most government employees
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says the government will offer buyouts to federal workers as part of his effort to shrink the government's workforce.

title: Daily Briefing: Trump's federal spending pause is frozen
shortDescription: A federal judge temporarily blocked a Trump funding freeze. Here is the news to know on Wednesday.

title: Congressional Democrats, Republicans spar over Trump's spending order
shortDescription: Democrats argued the new president vastly overreached his powers with a spending order Monday night.

title: From vaccines to antidepressants, RFK Jr.'s views face scrutiny in Senate
shortDescription: Kennedy vows to fight chronic disease, Big Pharma’s influence and ultra-processed food. Here's why his confirmation hearings in the Senate may draw fireworks.

title: Elon Musk: Trump orders SpaceX to bring back Starliner astronauts
shortDescription: On Tuesday, Elon Musk took to X to state President Trump has asked for the quick return of two NASA astronauts who flew to space in June.

title: Trump hobbles anti-discrimination and labor boards by firing Democrats
shortDescription: The unprecedented moves leave the agencies unable to conduct even routine business and are likely to spur legal challenges.

title: White House opens credentials to 'new media'
shortDescription: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt announced new media members like bloggers and podcasters can apply for press credentials.

title: Trump blocks federal support for gender-affirming care for youth
shortDescription: President Donald Trump directed the federal government not to help with gender transitions for individuals under the age of 19 in an executive order.

title: Trump's aid freeze stops distribution of HIV drugs in poor countries
shortDescription: As part of the foreign aid freeze by President Donald Trump, the U.S. distribution of HIV drugs in poor countries has been stopped.

title: Jim Acosta exits CNN: look back at his career covering the White House
shortDescription: Jim Acosta, journalist and fervent critic of President Donald Trump, announced he was leaving CNN after being with the network since 2007.

title: President Trump offers buyouts to all federal employees
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is offering buyouts with eight months of pay to all federal workers who don't wish to return to the office.

title: No, police union hasn’t rescinded Trump endorsement | Fact check
shortDescription: While the Fraternal Order of Police says it is discouraged by pardons and commutations issued by Biden and Trump, it didn't rescind its endorsement.

title: Judge blocks Trump policy that would pause federal grant funding
shortDescription: Advocacy groups for nonprofits, health care and small business fought to block the memo they argued could lead to 'catastrophic' harm cutting funding.

title: Who is White House's youngest press secretary Karoline Leavitt?
shortDescription: Trump 2024 presidential campaign spokesperson Karoline Leavitt made her debut as White House's youngest press secretary on Tuesday.

title: Judge struck down Biden's pardons? No, that's satire | Fact check
shortDescription: The claim originated on a satirical website but is presented in the post as authentic and attributes the decision to a nonexistent judge.

title: White House responds to pause in federal grants
shortDescription: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt responded to questions surrounding the Trump administrations pause in federal grants and loans.

title: White House says New Jersey drones were 'not the enemy'
shortDescription: Mysterious drones that hovered over New Jersey last month were authorized by the FAA for research and recreation purposes, the White House says.

title: Trump snaps at Jim Acosta during his first term: 'This is not happy talk'
shortDescription: During his first term, President Donald Trump repeatedly clashed with Jim Acosta and said CNN had the "worst record in the history of broadcasting."

title: Netanyahu says he will visit Trump at the White House amid ceasefire
shortDescription: President Trump said a day earlier that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would visit 'very soon.'

title: Trump administration sued over pause in grants
shortDescription: Advocacy groups for nonprofits, health organizations for small businesses told a federal court Trump's pause in grant funding could be 'catastrophic'

title: Indiana man pardoned by Trump for Jan. 6 riots killed at traffic stop
shortDescription: A Jasper County Sheriff’s deputy shot and killed 42-year-old Matthew Huttle during a traffic stop in Indiana on Sunday, Jan. 26, 2025. Huttle was recently pardoned by President Donald Trump for his role in the 2021 U.S. Capitol riots.

title: Trump's funding pause won't impact federal student loans, Pell Grants
shortDescription: The Education Department said Tuesday that federal student loans and Pell Grants won't stop flowing to students amid a broader federal funding pause.

title: Senate confirms Sean Duffy as secretary of Transportation
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said Duffy would use his past experience in Congress to help rebuild the country’s infrastructure and improve travel safety.

title: What we know about Trump's pause on federal grants, loans
shortDescription: The Trump administration memo prompted consternation in Washington about which federal government programs could expect to continue past Tuesday.

title: Michigan's Gary Peters won't run for US Senate reelection in 2026
shortDescription: Democrat Gary Peters' announcement means Michigan will have an open U.S. Senate seat for the second time in two years.
